item.title: Preparing for the New Academic Year â€” Plans and Goals
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week of July 23 â€“ July 29

The vacation is gradually reaching its midpoint, and thoughts are beginning to return to studies.

This week was dedicated to planning: I made a list of goals for the upcoming semester, highlighting courses and topics I want to explore further. I plan to focus especially on databases and the English language.

I also tried keeping a study journal to structure tasks and track progress. Vacation provides time to reflect, which means it also helps prepare for new achievements.

item.title: A Trip to Nature â€” Balancing Study and Rest
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week of July 16 â€“ July 22

This week was spent outdoors â€” together with friends we went out of town. It felt great to change the environment after the stressful exams and the hustle of city life.

A campfire, forest walks, and late-night conversations helped me reset. I even managed to solve a couple of programming problems on my laptop â€” the brain keeps seeking activity anyway.

Such a balance â€” rest combined with a bit of study â€” turned out to be very beneficial.

item.title: Summer in the City â€” Meetings and New Impressions
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week of July 9 â€“ July 15

This week the vacation became more active. I met with classmates, we walked around Moscow together and discussed our plans for the upcoming academic year.

I also visited a digital technology exhibition â€” it was fascinating to see real examples of how artificial intelligence and automation are applied in practice.

In addition, I started exploring new hobbies: digital drawing and listening to English podcasts. The vacation is becoming not only a time for rest, but also an opportunity to grow in areas that truly inspire me.

item.title: First Days of Vacation â€” Rest After a Stressful Exam Session
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week of July 2 â€“ July 8

The exam session is behind me, and now I can finally take a breath. The first days of vacation are all about well-deserved rest.

Most of the week I spent at home â€” catching up on sleep and enjoying the freedom of having no strict schedule. At last, I had time to read books outside the academic program and spend quality moments with friends.

The vacation has just begun, and there are plenty of plans ahead: trips, new hobbies, and self-development.

item.title: Exam Session â€” The First Major Test of Knowledge
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week of June 25 â€“ July 1

This week marked the most intense part of the academic year â€” the exam session.
The exams turned out to be a serious challenge: preparing for economics and programming was especially demanding.

Despite the stress, it was rewarding to realize that the knowledge is gradually forming into a coherent system. A lot of time was spent in the library, consulting with professors, and solving problems together with classmates.

The most important thing is that I managed to cope and gained valuable experience that will be useful in my further studies.
